solution_line_template: On Thursday, Monica studied for {thursday_multiplier} * {wednesday_hours} = <<{thursday_multiplier}*{wednesday_hours}={thursday_hours}>>{thursday_hours} hours.
On Friday, Monica studied half as much, so {thursday_hours} / {friday_divisor} = <<{thursday_hours}/{friday_divisor}={friday_hours}>>{friday_hours} hours.

Till the weekend, Monica studied in total for {wednesday_hours} + {thursday_hours} + {friday_hours} = <<{wednesday_hours}+{thursday_hours}+{friday_hours}={total_before_weekend}>>{total_before_weekend} hours.

That means, on the weekend Monica studied the same amount of time, so in total, she studied for {total_before_weekend} + {total_before_weekend} = <<{total_before_weekend}+{total_before_weekend}={total_study_time}>>{total_study_time} hours.
